alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT DALE...SOUTHWESTERN HENRY AND NORTHERN HOUSTON COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Doster to near Ozark to near Dothan to near Ashford. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Headland, Dothan, Ozark, Fort Novosel, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Newton, Webb, Ariton, Columbia, Pinckard, Rehobeth, Grimes, Avon, Newville, and Napier Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
